summary.overview: This JCL executes a timing control utility that introduces a 36-second delay in batch processing workflows. It serves as a synchronization mechanism to ensure proper sequencing and coordination between different processing steps in the card demo application system.
business_functions: Wait Control - Implements a controlled 36-second delay to synchronize batch processing operations
Process Coordination - Ensures proper timing between sequential job steps and external system dependencies
Workflow Management - Provides timing buffer for system resource availability and database synchronization

WAITSTEP.jcl.program_overview: Implements wait/delay functionality for timing control in batch processing
Low-level assembly routine that provides system wait capabilities

datasource_summary.name: Card Demo Program Library (AWS.M2.CARDDEMO.LOADLIB)
datasource_summary.function: Library containing executable COBOL programs, specifically used to access the COBSWAIT program for execution

datasource_summary.name: System Output (SYSOUT)
datasource_summary.function: Output destination for system messages, program output, and diagnostic information generated during program execution

datasource_summary.name: System Input (SYSIN)
datasource_summary.function: Input data containing wait time configuration (3600 centiseconds/36 seconds) that controls program execution timing
